resources.string: Which method is used to call methods from a superclass?
.super()
.inheritSuper()
.inherit()
.getSuper()
OOP allows you derive new classes from existing ones. This refers to:
Abstraction
Polymorphism
Inheritance
Encapsulation
Which of the following statements regarding sub classes is true?
You can call methods from the super class using the prefix ".inherit"
You can call methods from a sub class by using the prefix ".sub"
You can call methods from the super class by using the prefix ".super"
You can call methods from a sub class by using the prefix ".get"
Given that the "Student" class is a sub class of the "User" class:
You can only instantiate objects of the "Student" class
You can instantiate objects of both the "Student" and "User" class
You can instantiate objects of the "User" class with a Student constructor
Both B and C
Which of the following is a keyword in Java?
instanceOf
instanceof
cast
casting
Which keyword is used to link a sub class to its super class?
extends
implements
inherits
depends
Which of the following statements regarding super and sub classes is true?
A super and sub class will always have the same amount of information
A super class will always have more information than its sub class
A sub class will always have more information than its super class
None of the above
Which of the following statements is true for classes?
A no-arg constructor is provided by Java if no constructor is declared for a class
You must always explicitly declare a constructor
An arg constructor for a class is provided by default by Java
Both A and B
Polymorphism means that:
Variables can be cast into any other variable type
A variable of a sub type can refer to a super type object
A class can be derived from another existing class
A variable of a super type can refer to a sub type object
Abstract classes:
Can be instantiated
Can have non-abstract sub classes
Can only have abstract sub classes
Both A and C
Sub classes:
Can always be cast to a superclass
Will always contain details from the super class
Can inherit the methods from its super class
All of the above
You can have multiple methods with the same signature in the same class.
Yes, this is referred to as method overloading
Yes, this is referred to as method overriding
Yes, as long you are aware which method does what
No you cannot, they must be in separate classes
